title: School Library-Based Mathematical Inquiry Class Design in Remote Education Environments [Large-Scale]

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and experience with online learning tools
context.additional_context: A course supporting elementary educators in vocational training institutions to design effective inquiry-based math lessons in remote settings. Emphasizes blended learning strategies utilizing school library resources

learning_goals: Learners can describe a blended learning design framework for remote math inquiry classes, divided into three or more phases.
Learners can design two or more mathematical problem-solving activities using digital library resources (online databases, e-books, etc.).
Learners can develop stepwise online inquiry lesson materials tailored to learner proficiency levels by applying scaffolding techniques.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
